title: Trail of 'devastation' as a lorry spills its load of Becks beer on the road
text:
This is the moment a lorry driver leaves a trail of smashed bottles behind him when dozens of crates of Becks beer fall from his vehicle and crash onto a road.

The clip, believed to be filmed in Germany, captures a motorist as he passes a Red Cargo lorry which had pulled over onto the hard shoulder.

As the driver edges past the lorry, green and silver crates of Becks beer can be seen lining the road to the left of him, with smashed bottles pouring alcohol onto the concrete.

But as the onlooker travels further down the road, the quantity of crates on the road increases dramatically, with hundreds of bottles seen spilling out of boxes a few yards from the lorry.

The clip, believed to be filmed in Germany, captures a motorist as he passes a Red Cargo lorry which had pulled over on the side of a dual carriageway

At one point in the clip, a man in a Hi-Vis vest is seen standing in the middle of a mountain of broken bottles.

It appears the bottles had been pushed from the road into a neat pile on the hard shoulder.

The trail of smashed crates and bottles continues for another few yards, with two men stood by what appears to be an emergency response vehicle at the end of the accident.

The footage, which has been viewed more than 40,000 times, was posted to Facebook last week. The caption read: 'I feel like crying'.
